name: EML version 2.1.0 or beyond
description: Check the EML document declaration for version 2.1.0 or higher
expected: eml://ecoinformatics.org/eml-2.1.0, eml://ecoinformatics.org/eml-2.1.1
explanation: validity of this quality report is dependent on this check being valid
suggestion: use approved namespace

name: Document is schema valid EML
description: Check document schema validity
expected: schema-valid
explanation: validity of this quality report is dependent on this check being valid
suggestion: Make this doc valid.
reference: LTER best practices for data package construction (does not yet exist)

name: Document is EML parser valid
description: Validates with the EML IDs and references parser
expected: Validates with the EML IDs and references parser
explanation: validity of this quality report is dependent on this check being valid
suggestion: Resolve issues with IDs and references

name: Online URLs are live
description: check that URLs return something
expected: no 404s (any other bad responses?)
suggestion: fix broken URLs
failure notes: the data URLs redirect the user to a form before returning the data entity.

name: There are no duplicate entity names
description: checks that content is not duplicated by other entityName elements in the document.
EML path: dataTable/entityName; spatialRaster/entityName; spatialVector/entityName; storedProcedure/entityName; view/entityName; otherEntity/entityName
expected: (1) entityName is not an empty string; (2) entityName is not a duplicate within the document
found: (2) entityName is a duplicate value of some other entityName in the document. Note: this is valid in all versions of EML 2.1
explanation: Data Manager requires a non-empty non-duplicate entityName value for every entity.
suggestion: Declare a non-empty entityName and ensure that there are no duplicate entityName values in the document.

name: check to see if numFooterLines element is present
description: Check for presence of the 'numFooterLines' element
expected: Document contains 'numFooterLines' element.
explanation: If data file contains footer lines, 'numFooterLines' must be specified.
suggestion: Add 'numFooterLines' element if needed.

name: check to see if numHeaderLines element is present
description: Check for presence of the 'numHeaderLines' element
expected: Document contains 'numHeaderLines' element.
explanation: If data file contains header lines, 'numHeaderLines' must be specified.
suggestion: Add 'numHeaderLines' element if needed.

name: Number of records in metadata matches number of rows loaded
description: compare number of records specified in metadata to number of records found in data
EML path: optional: dataTable/numberOfRecords; required: physical/*/recordDelimiter; optional: dataTable/numHeaderLines; optional: dataTable/numFooterLines
expected: number of records successfully loaded = numberOfRecords value in the EML
explanation: description now handles all combinations of data and metadata.
suggestion: number of records loaded should be > 0.
failure notes: see sheet "number of records check"

name: Identify data URL
description: figure out which URL in the metdata is supposed to deliver data entity.
expected: one URL  to data!
explanation: checker does not know which url to use
suggestion: remove one url
reference: BP has specified which location is preferred for data URL: /eml:eml/dataset/dataTable/physical/distribution/online

name: Data can be loaded into the database
description: Case (1) Report when a data table loads into the database successfully. Case (2) Report any problems that occurred while loading the data table into a relational database. (3) Report that no attempt was made to load the data entity into a database.
expected: Case (1) Data loaded successfully or Case (3) no attempt was made to load the data.
found: Case (2) An error occurred while the data table was being loaded into a database
explanation: Case (2) Use the error message (for example, the message from a SQLException) as the explanation for the error. Also include the SQL insert statement that resulted in the error.
failure notes: We have observed that many failures are caused by incompatibilities between EML datetime formats and what Postgres will accept as a timestamp. This is an implementation issue that we need to work on.

name: Field delimiter is a single character
description: field delimiters should be one character only
expected: a single character is expected
explanation: fieldDelimiter should be a single character such as (,;:|) or an escape of a single character such as \t for tab. Decimal or hex values of ASCII characters may be used such as #32, #x20, or 0x20 for the space character.
suggestion: fieldDelimiter must be a single character or its representation, either decimal, hex, or escaped
failure notes: 3 entities have the word 'comma'

name: Data does not have fewer fields than metadata attributes
description: compare number of fields specified in metadata to number of fields found in data records
found: a record has a number of fields less than specified number of attributes.Return that record's position.
suggestion: Check the row for problems (un-escaped delimiters, unquoted strings, too few fields). Also check these elements in metadata: collapseDelimiters, recordDelimiter, fieldDelimiter, quoteCharacter.

name: header row is displayed alongside attribute names
description: compare tne content of the data header row to the content to attribute names
expected: no expectation, information only
found: display last line of header and display list of attribute names
explanation: checker should report only
suggestion: customer evaluate
reference: EML BP v1 suggested that attributeName content is the same. V2, maybe not.

name: Numeric fields do not have string content
description: Check for presence of a non-numeric string when a number is expected
expected: numeric value
found: non-numeric string value (other than defined missing value codes)
explanation: show customer the numericType and sample of data.
suggestion: customer evaluate

name: Dates are within stated bounds
description: compare date range in attrbute metadata to that at dataset level   Must honor content of the required attribute 'exclusive'
expected: entries within date field(s) bounded by metadata date range
found: returns warning if dates outside metadata range
explanation: This field is prescriptive, and states allowable range. so there is not a provision to not inforce.
suggestion: Best: update range in metadata or fix data so values match (whichever is appropriate), or next-best: drop this optional eml node.

name: Date format in metadata matches data
description: dateTime/formatString in attribute metadata is from the preferred list, and the data matches. A non-match generates only a warn. also see date format non-preferred check.
expected: format string is preferred, and all values match format string
found: dates that do not match formatString
explanation: One or more dates do not match the given format string
suggestion: dates should be consistently formatted and match the formatString in metadata.
failure notes: metadata: MM-DD-YYYY, data: MM/DD/YYYY. but entity was successfully  read by DML into postgres (sbc's app).

name: ISO date format check. possibly out of scope:
description: check to see if the date formats are ISO
expected: date string and dates are ISO
explanation: the normative docs and EML BP do not do a good job of describing an ISO date
suggestion: add to  EML BP, ref the customer there.
failure notes: found this: timestamp_local,timestamp_utc,... 2000-10-01T00:00,2000-10-01T07:00,...  in data, with mangled dateTime/format

name: Out of scope: UTC offset check
description: If data are labeled with a UTC offset, check that data agree with stated offset.
failure notes: dataset has 2 time columns, one labeled UTC, one local, which are supposed to represent the same instant. The time offset is given as -8 hours, but some data are only 7 hours apart.

name: If constraint specified notNull, then data has no null fields
description: If an attribute has been desginated to be "non null", then the data in that column should have no NULL fields.
expected: this column in data has no null fields
explanation: Metadata says that data values for <attribute> should not be null, but null values were found in theses rows: row# row content
suggestion: repair data table, or reset metadata, as apporpriate

name: Other constraint checks
description: probably out of scope for this version of the checker.

name: Data are examined and possible record delimiters are displayed
description: If no record delimiter was specified, we assume that \r\n is the delimiter. Search the first row for other record delimiters and see if other delimiters are found.
expected: No other potential record delimiters expected in the first row.
found: other potential record delimiters were found
explanation: Detection of line endings may be automatic on most systems, so this may not be important.
suggestion: Ensure that record delimiters are correctly specified.
failure notes: metadata says #x0A, data says \r\n

name: entity level URL returns data
description: Checks whether a URL returns data. Unless the URL is specified to be  function="information", the URL should return the resource for download.
expected: A data entity that matches the metadata
found: Case 1. an http error response code;   Case 2. some other web page.
explanation: Case 1: interpret response code, e.g., 404=broken url;  Case 2: found a web page instead of data entity
suggestion: URL should return a data entity

name: Display downloaded data
description: Display the first kilobyte of data that is downloaded
expected: Up to one kilobyte of data should be displayed

name: Display first insert row
description: Display the first row of data values to be inserted into the database table
expected: The first row of data values should be displayed
explanation: there is content, show customer
suggestion: customer evaluate
failure notes: data are under https, requires login

name: Duplicate data rows are displayed
description: The customer should know if there are duplicate lines of data. this is another info check, but may be out of scope.
expected: no of rows loaded = number of unique rows loaded
explanation: Tell the customer that duplicate rows were found
suggestion: customer evaluate

name: Missing value codes check
priority: deprecate in favor of sticky row 15
description: The customer should know if there are data fields which should be declared as missing values but are not.  this is another info check, and may be out of scope. See comment, and below.
expected: 1. no empty fields?, 2. all fields that are not missing values are correctly typed
explanation: Tell the customer that rows were found that had empty values.
suggestion: Please use the notNullConstraint element where appropriate, otherwise nulls are allowed.

name: Other missing value codes check
description: Possibly out of scope for this version.  This field is related to the data typing check

name: packageId pattern matches "scope.identifier.revision"
description: check against requirements for scope.identifier.revision
expected: tbd
explanation: tbd
suggestion: packageId must conform
reference: tbd. should this go into BP now? also see <alternateIdentifier>
failure notes: packageId="knb-lter-ntl.10022006112019153.2" system="http://lterquery.limnology.wisc.edu"

name: Entity id matches attribute qualifier
description: checks to see if entity id is present

name: if attribute had enumeratedDomain, data values are within domain
description: Compare data values to a list in metadata, lists codes not found in metadata. compare should not be case-sensitive (if caseSensittive='no"). Also see attribute enforced="yes|no"
expected: if <enumeratedDomain enforce="yes">  or not present, then all values in data entity attribute (col) should be in metadata.
found: data that were not in the domain
explanation: data have values that are not in enumeratedDomain/code fields. The attribute 'enforced' is optional, but defaults to "yes"
suggestion: best: add code:defintion pairs for these values found in data: XX, ZZ CC. Next-best, change node parent to <enumeratedDomain enforce="no">

name: attributeName is not in a reserved word [LIST]
description: check that attributes are not reserved words. the scope of what is reserved is  still TBA
expected: no reserved words
explanation: a community might disallow certrain wods as attribute names.
suggestion: don't use workds from this list

name: Database table created
description: Checks that a database table could be generated from the EML attribute list
expected: A database table is successfully created
found: SQL error while creating the database table
explanation: CREATE TABLE statement, as well as SQL error message (if applicable)
example failure: SQLException while generating data table 'Average_monthly_sea_surface_temperature' for entity 'Average monthly sea surface temperature': ERROR: syntax error at or near "(" Position: 76 CREATE TABLE Average_monthly_sea_surface_temperature(seq_day TIMESTAMP,date(YYYYMMDD) TIMESTAMP,sst_mean FLOAT,sst_anomaly FLOAT);
failure notes: Failures might be caused by the Data Manager Library not using the correct SQL syntax for the DDL statement that creates the table. Even in these cases, it's important to report errors so that bugs in the Data Manager Library code can be fixed.

name: Attribute names are unique
description: Checks if attributeName values are unique in the table. Not required by EML.
expected: Unique attribute names.
found: EML attributeName elements with identical content
explanation: A good table does not have duplicate column names.
suggestion: Check attribute names; best practice says these should be unique.

name: at least one controlled vocabulary term (preferred or non-preferred) is in keywords
description: dataset contains one or more terms from LTER vocab case insensitive, whole term
expected: at least one keyword in the doc can be found in the controlled vocab hierarchy (preferred or non-preferred)
found: no keywords that are in LTER vocab.
explanation: quite possibly dataset searches will only search keyword fields. So every doc should have  at least one keyword node containing a term from LTER vocab.
suggestion: add one or more keywords from the LTER Vocab.
reference: (tba) controlled vocab best practices and EML BP v.2 page 18
column23: attributeIds are qualified with table name

name: check to see if Controlled vocabulary preferred term is present
description: preferred keywords from LTER vocab
expected: document has preferred form for a term in the LTER vocab.
found: no keywords match controlled vocab preferred term
explanation: users want to know if their keywords include the preferred term.
suggestion: add one or more preferred keywords from the LTER Vocab.

name: check to see if temporalCoverage element is present
description: Check that temporalCoverage exists in EML at the dataset level, or at least one entity's level, or at least one attribute's level.
expected: temporalCoverage at least at the dataset level.
found: Report the total number of temporalCoverage elements found.
explanation: LTER wants to search  datasets by time; the best place to search is the dataset level temporal coverage.
suggestion: Most datasets have a temporal range.
failure notes: temporal coverage is not appropriate for mcr.6001.2.The bes.404.49 example is missing its coverage

name: check to see if geographicCoverage is present
description: Check that geographicCoverage exists in EML at the dataset level, or at least one entity's level, or at least one attribute's level.
expected: geographicCoverage at least at the dataset level.
found: Report the total number of geographicCoverage elements found.
explanation: Many but not all datasets are appropriate to have spatial coverage.
suggestion: If sampling EML is used within methods, does that obviate geographicCoverage? Or should those sites be repeated or referenced?
reference: EML BP v.2 page 22 "one <geographicCoverage> element should be included, whose <boundingCoordinates> describe the extent of the data. " ... Additional <geographicCoverage> elements may be entered at the dataset level if there are significant distances between study sites and it would be confusing if they were grouped into one bounding box."  6 decimal places
failure notes: absence of geographicCoverage. Although there was no sampling, per se, it does pertain to a general geographic region.

name: check to see if taxonomicCoverage is present
description: Check that taxonomicCoverage exists in EML at the dataset level, or at least one entity's level, or at least one attribute's level.
expected: taxonomicCoverage at least at the dataset level.
found: Report the total number of taxonomicCoverage elements found.
explanation: Only when taxa are pertinent to the dataset will they have taxonomicCoverage.
suggestion: Could search title, abstract, keywords for any taxonomic name (huge). Could search keywordType="taxonomic".
failure notes: met data; has no organisms.  But how would checker determine that?

name: temporalCoverage matches data
description: if there is a date column, does range match bounds of coverage element?
EML path: dataset level:  /eml:eml/dataset/coverage dataTable level:  /eml:eml/dataset/dataTable/coverage attribute level:   /eml:eml/dataset/dataTable/attributeList/attribute/coverage
expected: dates read from dataTable datetime columns are within temporalCoverage rangeOfDates or singleDate.
found: fails if a date is out of coveage range
explanation: Dates in data table should be within range of dates in temporalCoverage.
failure notes: data goes thru 2007-Dec-31 but coverage ends on Oct-31.  (Also title has 2006.)

name: jagged array
description: common to see a last column for comments is blank, even w/o delimiter for majority of rows.
expected: All rows should have same number of columns.
explanation: DML assumes missing columns are all nulls of right-hand-side columns. So jagged arrays will load but not necessarily correctly. Only if data type miss-matches occur will the DML reject a row.
suggestion: Do not allow jagged arrays; require missing value codes. (No ,,)

name: title has site acronym
description: does the title have the site's acronym
expected: site acronym in title.         Perhaps remove this check? It is more for federation, not within the LTER catalog that it matters.
found: Title contains one of the 28 acronyms (including NIN and LNO). Case sensitive due to AND.      Last 3 letters of scope, capitalized, occurs in title.
explanation: When LTER datasets get federated beyond LTER, having ABC LTER in the title may help carry identity/recognition.

name: check to see if an entity description is present
description: Check for presence of an entity description.
expected: Best practices pp.32-33 - "should have enough information for a user..."
explanation: With entityName serving as a file name rather than a title, it is important to be very descriptive here.

name: dataset title length is at 5 least words
description: if the title is shorter than 5 words, it might be insufficient. Title word count >= 7 and <= 20 including prepositions and numbers.
expected: Between 7 and 20 "words".
found: Number of "words" found in the title.
explanation: Best practices document, page 13, says write a good title. This is the first view of a dataset. To include what, where and when takes at least 7 words. This at there from YYYY.
suggestion: If too short: "Ensure title covers what, where and when". If too long: "Title more concisely."
example failure: knb-lter-arc.1349.1 one word. knb-lter-pie.85.3 has 39 word title. knb-lter-arc.1661.3 has 23 words so would fail.
failure notes: title = "93pektmp.txt" the filename.  pie example title is the abstract.

name: check to see if one of dataTable, view, spatialRaster or spatialVector is present
description: only entity types that require attributes can be checked
expected: Best practices p.33
suggestion: only entities that require attributeLists can be checked. otherEntity cannot be checked.

name: Length of entityName is not excessive (less than 100 char)
description: length of entity name is less than 100 characters

name: presence of objectName for function="download"
description: not sure - objectName may only have passive use

name: Numeric values are within stated bounds
description: compare data to stated bounds in metadata. Also honor content of required attribute 'exclusive'
expected: all values should be within range
found: data that were not in the domain
explanation: this field is prescriptive, and states allowable range. so there is not a provision to not inforce.
suggestion: Best: update range in metadata or fix data so values match (whichever is appropriate), or next-best: drop this optional eml node.

name: presence of externallyDefined Format when otherEntity used
description: otherEntity implies an external format which should be described

name: check for function="download"
description: download is necessary to indicate data is directly available

name: presence of textFormat with dataTable
description: only text data can be loaded into a database,

name: temporalCoverage endDate is not in the future
description: endDate is not later than today
expected: <endDate> not in future.
found: fails if endDate in future of date of check
explanation: It is better to state an end date that guarantees that the data are present up to that date with more data possibly being available in future.
suggestion: The endDate should be the last date of data included in this revision of this dataset.
failure notes: bnz.379 is model output thru year 2100

name: title includes year(s)
description: Start year and either "ongoing" or end year should appear in title. When entire EML is presented, temporalCoverage handles this.  However, in a citation only the title covers this.
expected: At least one four-digit number should appear in title.
found: No four-digit number appears in title.
explanation: Start date (and end date when not ongoing) should appear in the title as a four-digit number.
suggestion: Include date(s) in title.
failure notes: no year in title.  Should say "2001, ongoing."

name: pubDate element is present
description: Check for presence of the pubDate element
expected: The date that the dataset was submitted for publication in pasta must be included.  (The EML schema does not require this element, but when present, does constrain its format to YYYY-MM-DD or just YYYY.  Citation format uses only the YYYY portion even if a full date is entered.)
explanation: pubDate is part of citation. pubDate qualifies use of "ongoing" in other metadata elements.
suggestion: The <pubDate> should be updated when data and/or metadata are updated or re released. The format can be either a 4-digit year, or an ISO date (YYYY-MM-DD).  EML BP v.2 p. 17
reference: The year of public release of data online should be listed as the <pubDate> element . The <pubDate> should be updated when data and/or metadata are updated or re released. The format can be either a 4-digit year, or an ISO date (YYYY-MM-DD).  EML BP v.2 p. 17
failure notes: missing its pubDate

name: check to see if pubDate congruent
description: compare last date in data files to pubDate.
expected: pubDate should be on or after last date in data.
found: latest date in data is after pubDate
explanation: warn may have forgotten to update pubDate.  Or pubDate may be miss-used; it is not the release date of the first version.  It is the publication date of the current revision.
suggestion: update pubDate when updating a dataset
example failure: knb-lter-pie.129.3  pubDate is mid-range of temporalCoverage.  knb-lter-ntl.205.2 uses data date for pubDate.
failure notes: pubDate cannot be before last data in dataset since dataset is published on pubDate.

name: check to see if organizationName present as creator
description: organizationName is used in citation
expected: <creator id="org-1" system="FLS" scope="system"> <organizationName>Fictitious LTER Site</organizationName>
found: first creator is site with orgName
suggestion: The first creator listed should be the LTER site itself. <organizationName> should contain the site name.
failure notes: bes.404.49 has a publisher/organizationName but it contains contact instructions and Data Use Policy instead of an organizationName.     No org under creator.

name: check to see if intellectualRights element is present
description: Data Use Policy can be inline or cited via a URL. Each site can have its own or use the Network's. Even if a site chooses to waive these, it is better to be explicit.
expected: Often using complex text elements such as <itemizedList>, this section of eml is "boilerplate" inserted identically in most eml docs from a site, with exceptions for exogenous/reference data such as USGS data.
explanation: <intellectualRights> should contain site data access policy, plus a description of any deviation from the general access policy specific for this particular dataset (e.g. restricted- access datasets). The timeframe for release should be included as well. - BP
suggestion: It is recommended that data use policy be explicit.
failure notes: missing intellectualRights

name: check to see if  methods element is present
description: All datasets should contain a methods element, at a minimum a link to a separate methods doc.
EML path: /eml:eml/dataset/methods /eml:eml/dataset/dataTable/methods /eml:eml/dataset/dataTable/attributeList/attribute/  where dataTable may be any entity type.
expected: presence of <methods> at one or more xpaths. Same logic as for temporalCoverage.
explanation: As a minimum, a reference to an external protocol should be given at the dataset level. However, detailed methods at this level are preferable. If further refinement is needed, methods can be defined for individual data entities or even individual <attribute>s if necessary.  - BP
suggestion: Since they are mostly for human consumption, one detailed description of all steps taken at the dataset level is frequently sufficient and more user friendly. - BP
failure notes: although methods appear at the NWT site, the eml omits them.

name: check to see if publisher element is present
description: publisher element is present
suggestion: publisher is useful for building a proper citation.
failure notes: can creator/orgName sub for this?

name: pubDate is not in future
description: since pasta knows the current date, so can compare years.
expected: year of pubDate is not in the future).
found: year of pubDate is a future year
suggestion: See best practices, pubdate is not initial release date.
reference: EML BP says to update pubdate for significant revisions. significant revisions are not defined.

name: unencoded characters
priority: deprecate maybe.  stick with utf8, or file a bug
description: encoding errors result from characters such as: Î¼ in micron or an "em dash" or degree symbol.  Sometimes  these are not a problem, sometimes they cause (at least the web form) DPM to not return a result. Determine how to properly use odd characters.
expected: the right encoding
found: encoding that does not match, ie not UTF-8
explanation: Ideally, show the offending character, not just "unencoded" generic message.
failure notes: Response Body Invalid byte 1 of 1-byte UTF-8 sequence.

name: Data does not have more fields than metadata attributes
description: compare number of fields specified in metadata to number of fields found in data records
found: a record has a number of fields more than specified number of attributes.Return that record's position.
suggestion: Check the row for problems (un-escaped delimiters, unquoted strings, extra fields). Also check these elements in metadata: collapseDelimiters, recordDelimiter, fieldDelimiter, quoteCharacter.

name: customUnit was found in the LTER unit dictionary
description: compre string to unit dictionary and report wihch came from the unit dictionary
expected: custom units are from the unit dictionary
explanation: The unit dictionary's custom units are well constructed

name: Dereferenced document is schema-valid EML
description: References are dereferenced, and the resulting file validated
expected: schema-valid
explanation: validity of this quality report is dependent on this check being valid
suggestion: Make sure that references refer to the correct elements

name: Integer fields do not include floats
description: Check for presence of a float value when an integer value is expected
expected: integer value
explanation: show customer the numericType and sample of data.
suggestion: customer evaluate

name: Date format string is allowed
description: Check for legal date format values in the metadata
expected: valid formatString
explanation: formatString is not in a list of recommended/standard datetime format strings
suggestion: check the list of standard datetime format strings
failure notes: fails because it's lowercase; should be MM/DD/YYYY

name: enumeratedDomain codes are unique
description: check that all codes are unique
expected: codes are unique
explanation: codes should be unique.
suggestion: please use unique codes in an enumerated domain

name: Entity names are unique
priority: deprecate in favor of sticky row 6
description: entity names should be unique in a dataset.
expected: entity names in a package are unique
explanation: entity names are used by the DML and pasta. Duplicate names are not good practice.
suggestion: use unique entity names

name: check to see if recordDelimiter element is present
description: Check presence of record delimiter. Check that the record delimiter is one of the suggested values.
expected: A record delimiter from a list of suggested values: \n, \r, \r\n, #x0A, #x0D, #x0D#x0A
explanation: The record delimiter is not present or is not one of the suggested values.
suggestion: Add a record delimiter or change the record delimiter to one of the suggested values:\n, \r, \r\n, #x0A, #x0D, #x0D#x0A

name: objectName is valid file name
description: Object name is a valid file name
expected: objectName is a valid file name (linux)
explanation: the DAS uses the objectName to build a path to the file.
suggestion: sample file name:

name: Date format in metadata is a non-preferred format [LIST], and data matches
description: dateFormat in metadata is from the non-preferred list, and the data matches. A non match generates an error. also see date format preferred check. Data also match format string in metadata.
expected: format string is from the non-preferred list, and all values match format string

name: dataset abstract element is a minimum of 20 words
description: check the length of a dataset abstract, and warn if less than 20 words
expected: an abstract is more than 20 words
explanation: an abstract helps a user determine if the dataset is useful for a specific purpose. An abstract is sually a paragraph. while a very concise abstract could be sufficient, a
suggestion: add an abstract

name: check to see if coverage element is present
description: At least one coverage element should be present in a dataset. Schema requires that coverage has at least one child, so all checker needs to do is look for the parent. also see checks for specific children.

name: scope of packageId matches uid in access
description: The abc part of  knb-lter-abc should match the uid=ABC in /access/allow/principal/ except in lower vs upper case.
expected: matches
explanation: The site should own packages in its scope

name: check to see if keyword element is present
description: checks to see if at least one keyword is present
expected: Presence of one or more keyword elements
explanation: The LTER portal allows searches on keywords.This check is a precursor for checking on keywords from the controlled vocabulary.
suggestion: add at least one keyword

name: calendarDate year is on or before 9999
description: Alerts when year is beyond 9999. EML schema uses XML schema for year which allows years 10K and beyond but we are assuming no LTER data will be that far in future.
EML path: same as temporalCoverage/calendarDate which can occur at dataset level, dataTable level, or attribute level
expected: year is only 4 digits
explanation: The calendarDate year is expected to be 4 digits.
suggestion: Check the date format. Possibly hyphens were omitted or date format was not set.
failure notes: year is 5 digits (because the Excel template that generates the EML lost its date format)

name: check to see if funding element is present
description: checks to see if the funding element is included.
expected: the funding element is included
explanation: Searches will want to display datasets by funder or grant id.
suggestion: Include the funding source, please

name: illegal HTML characters should not be in EML
description: Alerts submitter if any illegal HTML characters are in the metadata. This can happen when text is pasted in and then converted to utf-8. If these are present, XML cannot be transformed to HTML.
expected: no illegal HTML characters (range: ___ to ___)
explanation: Illegal characters were found at this XML path: (display path)
suggestion: system for inserting text should not allow these characters, or convert from incoming character set to UTF-8.
failure notes: mcr.5008.1 has a degree symbol in methods. sbc.45.6 has an umlaut in methods (grep string 'Uterm').

name: check to see if access deny rules are present
description: PASTA respects all allow and deny rules in EML. DataONE ignores deny rules. Alert submitter if any deny rules are present before they submit.
expected: no deny rules are present
explanation: A deny rule was found at [display path]. This rule will be ignored by dataONE
suggestion: reconstruct the access conditions with allow-rules only
example failure: knb-lter-sbc.1216.3 (this is an EML 2.0.1. it should be replaced by a 2.1)

name: URLs are not broken
description: Check all the urls in a doc and alert submitter if any are broken
expected: URLs in the doc are not broken
explanation: URLs in the EML should not be broken.
suggestion: fix broken urls

name: the doc was giving a revision that will be allowed by PASTA
description: Alert the submitter if the doc being tested has a revsion that will not be allowed by PASTA when the doc is submitted.
expected: the revision number is greater than the current revison for this docid in production PASTA
found: The revision of the new doc is <= to the highest revision of the docid in the production system.
explanation: PASTA requires that revisions be unique and monotonically increasing.
suggestion: increase revision number

name: the end date of temporalCoverage is not in the future
description: Alert the submitter of the temporalCoverage element has an end date in the future.
expected: date is in the past.
explanation: Most data are collected in the past, and so their metadata should have dates in the past. This is a warn, since it doesn't stop processing, and to handle exceptions (such as model forecasts)
suggestion: check the end date

name: check to see if the data entiry is a zip file
description: ALert the user if a zipped file is found for a dataTable
expected: no zip file under dataTable
explanation: The file format must match the expectations of both PASTA and the Data Manager Library (DML).  Currently, the only way to do this for a dataTable is with an ascii file. Presently, other entity types (i.e., otherEntity, spatialRaster, spatialVector) are allowed to be delivered as zips.
suggestion: change to ascii format
failure notes: these are big tables, so were zipped to save space. But you cannot download a viable product from pasta.

name: check to see if a compressionMethod element is present
description: Alert user if there is a compressionMethod element
expected: no compressionMethod element
explanation: the behavior of the DML when it encounters a compressionMethod is to _____. This affects processing of all entity types.
suggestion: remove the compressionMethod element

name: check to see if an XML declaration is present
description: alert the user if there is no XML declaration above the root element.
explanation: The XML declaration is where you set the character set. It's optional, but good practice for XML docs. Maybe this one could be combined with a character-set declaration check.
suggestion: add an XML declaration and specify the character-set. ie <?xml version="1.0"  encoding="UTF-8"?>
failure notes: doc has no xml declaration

name: check dateFormat against the recommended list
description: Alert the user if the date format string is not in the recommended list.
expected: formatString is in the list of supported formats.
found: dateFormat is not in the list
explanation: This data format "<insert format>" is not on the list of recommended formats.  Software might be able to interpret the format and your data, but results may be unpredictable.  PASTA cannot check data-metadata congruence for any part of this entity.
suggestion: Preferred solution: use a recommended date format (like ISO) and reformat the data. Alternate solution, keep dates in this format, check congruence manually, and customize software to interpret it for analysis.

name: check selected elements for leading or trailing whitespace
description: Alert the submitter if critcal elements contain leading or traling whitespace. important fields include entityName, missing value codes, enumerations (nominal or ordinal measTypes)
expected: no leading or trailing whitespace
explanation: pasta uses the content of some EML fields. Leading or trailing whitespace in these is ambiguous. ideally, the submitter will remove the whitespace after receiving an alert. PASTA will clean leading and trailing whitespace as necessary before making level-1 EML
suggestion: remove leading and trailing whitespace from this element
reference: Duane mentioned a ticket, maybe #1543, called "whitespace cleanup"
failure notes: entity #2, entityName has trailing whitespace

name: check that a checksum in the L0 for entity matches the one pasta generates
description: 3 possible responses: valid, checksums match; warn, no checksum in L0; error checksums do not match
expected: a supported method (sha1, md5) and a checksum that matches the checksum generated by pasta
explanation: matching checksums (L0 and pataa-generated) will ensure data integrity during transfer to pasta.
suggestion: include the authentication element, with the method attribute

name: tba. see row 84.
Check that a L0-DOI resolves
description: Alert the submitter if there is a DOI in the dataset that does not resolve.
expected: content of the alteranteIdentifier element resolves
explanation: It is possible for a dataset to have been assigned a doi in another system. that doi might appear in the dataset submitted to pasta. It should resolve. The system attribute that could be called  "doi|DOI|doi.org", so proabaly contains('doi'), case-insensitive is enough.
suggestion: Don't put non-reslolving DOIs in datasets

name: an altID with system=DOI that looks like it's generated by PASTA should not be present
description: Reject the data package if it contains a DOI looks like pasta generated it.
EML path: contains(dataset/alternateIdentifier[@system=doi], 'pasta'), or some other identitfying part of the doi shoulder, e.g., "10.6073"
expected: no pasta DOIs in L0
explanation: pasta dois might appear in L0 packages (by various mechanisms). PASTA will assign the DOI, so an initial one should not be there.
suggestion: remove the DOI (pasta will add the DOI to L1 EML)

name: Check for presence of a physical/authentication element containing the info for an integrity check, including the method
description: Warn if an entity does not have a physical/authentication element, with an acceptable method.
expected: checksum element, with a method attribute from a predefined list of methods.
explanation: PASTA is planning to compare the contributor-supplied checksum value in the physical/authentication element to the one it computes at download.
suggestion: Add a physical/authentication element and store the entity checksum in it.

name: is the numberOfRecords element present
description: warn the user if the numberOfRecords check is not present
expected: numberOfRecords was not present
explanation: this is a valuable check that we have the correct table.
suggestion: Add a numberOfRecords element and store the number of entity records.

name: an orcid string matches the individualName/surname
description: if an individual has an orcid ID associated, check that the surname returned by ORCID matches what is in the EML
expected: surname in EML matches surname returned by ORCID
explanation: ORCIDs are used to unambiguoulsy link a data resource to an individual.
suggestion: be sure the ID you are using for this person is correct.
reference: find the BP ref, describing EML with ORCIDs. or write it.

name: dateTime/formatString specified in metadata is from a preferred set of values
description: Certain features of data formats are preferred, eg, ISO 8601, 4-digit years. This check looks at metadata to see if the format is in that prefered list. LIST
expected: string is a member of the preferred set
explanation: In the current version of EML (2.1), the dateTime/formatString is interpreted as ISO-8601. This check is classified as a warn, so other formats are allowed. In the future (e.g., future version of EML), other formatStrings may be added to the preferred list.
suggestion: Modify the dateTime/formatString, selecting from among the preferred values one that best matches the data format

name: Check for presence of an entity size element
description: Look for entity size element as and prep for checking congruence, and if not present, generate a warn. Note that to be most useful (i.e, to check congruence), entity size should contain the most precise measure of size, which is "byte" (the default unit); however the presence or name of the entity size unit is NOT checked.
expected: Entity size is present. if unit="byte" or unit is omitted (default = byte), then congruence can be checked
explanation: Examining the entity size is prep for checking congruence. Including the element is best practice, and if not present, a warn is generated. To be most useful, entity size should contain the most precise measure of size, which is "byte" (the default unit).
suggestion: Include an entity size in bytes
failure notes: example of a dataset that will fail check because size unit is not "byte": knb-lter-mcr.6.56

name: check that the entity size in the L0 metadata matches the one pasta generates
description: compare raw file size of file to [entity]/physical/size. return error is not matching.
expected: L0 size (raw file size in bytes, either as stated or unstated by default) matches file size as calculated by PASTA.
found: raw file size does not match size stated in L0
explanation: Examining the entity size is a method for checking that this is the correct entity.
suggestion: Check the entity size
failure notes: the one from HFR 312.1 ?
